key_risks: Class action lawsuit settlement for defective decking
Supply chain disruptions due to labor shortages and transportation delays
Intense market competition from other composite decking manufacturers and traditional wood suppliers
controversies: Class action lawsuit settlement for defective decking
Criticism regarding the long-term environmental impact and recyclability of composite materials
environmental_issues: Reliance on recycled polyethylene and reclaimed wood fibers, subject to cost fluctuations
Environmental scrutiny over the sustainability and recyclability of composite materials
social_issues: Potential impact on customer trust and brand reputation due to legal issues
Commitment to safe working conditions and supply chain transparency
governance_issues: Adherence to ethical practices as outlined in Human Rights Policy and Code of Conduct & Ethics

sources.snippet: WINCHESTER, VA., (June 27, 2024) — Trex Company, Inc. (NYSE:TREX), the world's largest manufacturer of high-performance, low-maintenance composite decking and railing, and a leading brand of outdoor living products, today published its 2023 Sustainability Report, "Seeing More Value in Sustainability."
